Interface: ViewProvider

ViewProvider

Exposes types of views in Open MCT.

Properties:
Name Type Attributes Description
key string

a unique identifier for this view
name string

the human-readable name of this view
description string <optional>

a longer-form description (typically a single sentence or short paragraph) of this kind of view
cssClass string <optional>

the CSS class to apply to labels for this view (to add icons, for instance)
Source:
  • ui/registries/ViewRegistry.js, line 159

Methods

canEdit(domainObject) → {boolean}

An optional function that defines whether or not this view can be used to edit a given object. If not provided, will default to false and the view will not support editing. To support editing, return true from this function and then -

  • Return a openmct.View from the view function, using the onEditModeChange callback to add and remove editing elements from the view OR
  • Return a openmct.View from the view function defining a read-only view. AND
  • Define an openmct.ViewProvider#Edit function on the view provider that returns an editing-specific view.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
domainObject module:openmct.DomainObject

the domain object to be edited
Source:
  • ui/registries/ViewRegistry.js, line 188
Returns:

'true' if the view can be used to edit the provided object, otherwise 'false'.

Type
boolean

canView(domainObject) → {boolean}

Check if this provider can supply views for a domain object.

When called by Open MCT, this may include additional arguments which are on the path to the object to be viewed; for instance, when viewing "A Folder" within "My Items", this method will be invoked with "A Folder" (as a domain object) as the first argument

Parameters:
Name Type Description
domainObject module:openmct.DomainObject

the domain object to be viewed
Source:
  • ui/registries/ViewRegistry.js, line 172
Returns:

'true' if the view applies to the provided object, otherwise 'false'.

Type
boolean

edit(object) → {module:openmct.View}

Provide an edit-mode specific view of this object.

If optionally specified, this function will be called when the application enters edit mode. This will cause the active non-edit mode view and its dom element to be destroyed.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
object *

the object to be edit
Source:
  • ui/registries/ViewRegistry.js, line 236
Returns:

an editable view of this domain object

Type
module:openmct.View

priority(domainObject) → {number}

Optional method determining the priority of a given view. If this function is not defined on a view provider, then a default priority of 100 will be applicable for all objects supported by this view.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
domainObject module:openmct.DomainObject

the domain object to be viewed
Source:
  • ui/registries/ViewRegistry.js, line 208
Returns:

The priority of the view. If multiple views could apply to an object, the view that returns the lowest number will be the default view.

Type
number

view(domainObject, objectPath, object) → {module:openmct.View}

Provide a view of this object.

When called by Open MCT, the following arguments will be passed to it:

Parameters:
Name Type Description
domainObject object

the domainObject that the view is provided for
objectPath array

The current contextual object path of the view object eg current domainObject is located under MyItems which is under Root
object *

the object to be viewed
Source:
  • ui/registries/ViewRegistry.js, line 222
Returns:

a view of this domain object

Type
module:openmct.View
